author: A. Hermansen
text: Be very careful with VC’s quality check system. It is inconsistent and at a very poor level. Items with clear defects goes through their quality check and the buyer has afterwards poor chances to get help from VC. Their costumer services and chat bot is horrible!!! And on top you pay a huge amount of money to sell and to get VC quality check support. I have closed my account - I was a happy costumer for many years but the last 1-2 years has proven to be a downhill ride in regards to quality and good service! Will not be coming back

author: Lorraine
text: Don’t buy on this! I bought a necklace that was supposed to be in new condition and went through quality control and it has an obvious fault where it’s missing a Pearl. Can’t get hold of them to get a refund.
title: Don’t buy on this

author: Anonymous
text: I purchased a pair of Chanel x Pharell Williams women's sneakers that were confirmed authentic by VC.  I sold the sneakers and had the sneakers go through another authentication. which failed and were confirmed FAKE.  Upon closer inspection and lots of internet research, I could then see that they were indeed fake.  I also checked the seller on VC "kdjluxe" who apparently operates a bogus business in France and also has an Instagram account "kdj_luxe" which states that they are no longer doing on business on PayPal because too many people were complaining about them.  They instead want a direct bank transfer and also do not do returns or provide refunds (fishy).  They also have a bogus website, yet have been in "business" for nearly a year.  The fact that VC has been conned by this seller is disturbing and even more disappointing that I have lost trust in them (I am a seller and was a buyer).  I am now in the process of trying to return the sneakers, so I can get a full refund.
title: VC Confirmed Authenticity for Fake Chanel Sneakers

author: Gabrielle
text: I’ve been waiting almost 3 weeks now for a refund that was supposed to take no longer than 5 days as the seller lied about the dimensions of the item. I’ve had to chase this company over 4 times regarding this as they kept promising me different dates to expect my refund without ever actually giving it to me. As somebody who’s worked in customer service, this company is a joke; they have an “expert” team and I imagine that my dog would be more competent in that job than they are.
title: If you’re looking to throw away your money then this is the company for you!

author: SJ
text:
Customer services is non existent.  No phone lines, no replies to emails - and the ‘chat’ service is only supported by AI. 
I have repeatedly asked for assistance with sending to Europe as the labels provided do not have the correct customs information.
The automatic system is very good at sending repeated reminders to post sold items: but no response to queries as to how to. 
Unfortunately I will have to stop using Vestiaire as customers are facing unacceptable delays.
title: Customer services is non existent

author: V333
text:
Been selling in VC for years and since mid February they suddenly haven’t paid me for any of my sold items. I can’t get in touch with anyone at all. I literally am now complaining in their instagram. Also the price you sell the item for after fees is not what turns up in your account, it’s always less. 

Really worried as they owe me money and seeing that I am not the only one experiencing this problem, I am wondering if VC is in trouble. I am in the U.K. What can I do to get my money?
title: I haven’t been paid!!!!

author: Mother
text:
I ordered 3 products on Vestiaire.
The first 2 products were fake products.  After ordering them for about $2000 each, they were never delivered, seller was unresponsive, and eventually I got a refund for 90% of the amount I paid.  So each purchase cost me $200, for nothing.  And they are still listed on the site for sale!  So basically, they list fake products and make $200 for each sale of fake products.
The 3rd product I ordered is still waiting for delivery.  And I realized they charge $800 for customs duty.  When I queried them on this, because customs duty should only be $100, they said it was non-negotiable.  So basically, whatever price you see the item for sale on the website, they add an additional 30% markup when you try to buy it, and make it a "customs fee".  I am now trying to cancel the 3rd product, but to no reply.

No, this website is clearly a scam.  Be very careful using it.
title: Scam - Be very careful

author: Yulia
text:
Vestiaire Collective, I think this is really time to reinvent your business. It has been getting worse and worse and by now it got to the point where it is unbearable.
My 5 cents to the rest who gave you 1 star: totally perfect authentic items are getting refused for no good reason, and what is funny, some of them had original brand documents. Still CS said "oh they were found to be fake".
Really?! So I am asking a question: is Vestiaire Collective trying to say that Chanel themselves accepted item for repair, fixed it, issued documents and somehow while physically handling the item they did not notice the item is fake? Such incompetent Chanel they are. 
And is Vestiaire Collective claiming such an enormous level of expertise which is better than the original brand by spotting a fake in the photo in a glimpse of an eye? Is that right? 
My 9(!) items were refused within 5 minutes: I even took screenshot from my mailbox. If you try to contact CS, they will send you a disgusting generic response saying "our experts are working very hard" and blah blah blah. That really does not look like working very hard. Each listing had 12-13 crisp clear photos together with super close up pics of the brand marks, detailed descriptions, items were in like new condition etc. How anyone could thoroughly check these in this timeframe?
Apparently not, as they did not even bother to check photos of the original documents supplied in the listings, just hit refuse button. And yes, if I could share all the proof here, I would.
How you treat your clients, Vestiaire, is atrocious. Sellers are also your clients, BTW, in case you missed that part.
The website is so full of obvious fakes while genuine items are getting refused by "experts". What. On. Earth.
SHAME ON YOU.
Wishing someone started a competitor project with the same system which is actually working while Vestiaire can continue to enjoy refusing authentic items and approving and authenticating fakes.
title: Experts? I really don't think so!

author: Sara
text: I have multiple bad experiences with Vestiaire Collective, mainly as a seller. Last situation was about an item I sold, and which I was unable to ship due to the DHL form missing.
